PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Example: reverse_search()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a rare event of a solar eclipse with a double ring."

...

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:k>)
```

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:53> This image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu's house taken by a Hezbollah drone in August 2024."

# Your Actions



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
```
reverse_search(<image:53>)
```
_________________________



SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:53> This image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu's house taken by a Hezbollah drone in August 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:53>)
```

# Search Result
From [Source](https://pesacheck.org/missing-context-this-image-of-israeli-prime-minister-benjamin-netanyahus-home-was-not-captured-by-9d48e97d86b7): Found exact image on website with title: MISSING CONTEXT: This image of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin ...

MISSING CONTEXT: This image of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s home was not captured by Hezbollah drone in August 2024
==================================================================================================================================

**The image dates back to 2019.**
---------------------------------

[![PesaCheck](https://miro.medium.com/v2/resize:fill:64:64/0*ttzO0bKO1LLBQdao.jpg)](https://medium.com/@PesaCheck?source=post_page---byline--9d48e97d86b7---------------------------------------)

[PesaCheck](https://medium.com/@PesaCheck?source=post_page---byline--9d48e97d86b7---------------------------------------)

4 min read

·

Aug 28, 2024

[](https://medium.com/m/signin?actionUrl=https%3A%2F%2Fmedium.com%2F_%2Fvote%2Fpesa-check%2F9d48e97d86b7&operation=register&redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fpesacheck.org%2Fmissing-context-this-image-of-israeli-prime-minister-benjamin-netanyahus-home-was-not-captured-by-9d48e97d86b7&user=PesaCheck&userId=c75918c2df6e&source=---header_actions--9d48e97d86b7---------------------clap_footer------------------)

\--

[](https://medium.com/m/signin?actionUrl=https%3A%2F%2Fmedium.com%2F_%2Fbookmark%2Fp%2F9d48e97d86b7&operation=register&redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fpesacheck.org%2Fmissing-context-this-image-of-israeli-prime-minister-benjamin-netanyahus-home-was-not-captured-by-9d48e97d86b7&source=---header_actions--9d48e97d86b7---------------------bookmark_footer------------------)

Listen

Share

A [post](https://archive.ph/LKIoV)
 shared on Threads with an image purportedly of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s home, taken by a Hezbollah drone in August 2024, is MISSING CONTEXT.

The post reads, “BREAKING Netanyahu’s residence in Caesarea has been filmed by a drone belonging to the Lebanese Hezbollah — Israel Hayom.”

The image was also shared on X (formerly Twitter) with similar claims in a [post](https://archive.ph/7EBDu)
 reading, “Netanyahu’s residence has been filmed by a Hezbollah drone…On target.”

According to media [reports](https://www.aa.com.tr/en/middle-east/hezbollah-drone-suspected-of-filming-netanyahus-home-report/3307013)
, a suspected [Hezbollah](https://www.cfr.org/backgrounder/what-hezbollah)
 drone that was purportedly filming Netanyahu’s home in Caesarea on 18 August 2024 was dismissed as a false alarm. The Lebanese militant group allied with [Hamas](https://apnews.com/article/hamas-hezbollah-houthis-iran-militant-groups-745bfc36e23997ee3f0bc499a9f5c16d)
 began striking Israel in October 2023 in [solidarity](https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/is-hezbollah-israel-conflict-about-spiral-2024-07-28/)
 with Palestinians in the Gaza Strip in the [ongoing](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/liveblog/2024/8/22/israels-war-on-gaza-live-mass-exodus-as-israel-expands-ground-invasion)
 war in the Middle East.

A Google Lens reverse image [search](https://archive.ph/BOoER)
 established the image in question predates current events.

The image was featured in a 25 June 2020 [article](https://www.timesofisrael.com/why-exactly-have-israelis-been-ordered-to-pay-netanyahus-taxes/)
 by _Times of Israel_ with the headline, “Why, exactly, have Israelis been ordered to pay Netanyahu’s taxes?”

The image, labelled as a screenshot, is attributed to _Kan_ public broadcaster and captioned: “Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s private residence in Caesarea.”

_KAN_ featured the image in a YouTube [video](https://youtu.be/k_VMJvSd8v0)
 uploaded on 1 July 2019.

The video’s title, translated from Hebrew, reads, “The villa in Caesarea: The Netanyahu family insists that the state finance the sealing works.”

PesaCheck has looked into a post shared on Threads with an image purportedly of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s home filmed by a Hezbollah drone in August 2024 and finds it to be MISSING CONTEXT.

_This post is part of an ongoing series of PesaCheck fact-checks examining content marked as_ **_potential misinformation_** _on Facebook and other social media platforms._

[_By partnering with Facebook and similar social media platforms_](/pesacheck-and-facebook-partner-to-fight-misinformation-in-kenya-d6a45ee70c18?gi=d2cb1ae7440)
_, third-party fact-checking organisations like PesaCheck are helping to sort fact from fiction. We do this by giving the public deeper insight and context to posts they see in their social media feeds._

_Have you spotted what you think is fake or false information on Facebook?_ [_Here’s how you can report_](https://www.facebook.com/help/572838089565953?helpref=faq_content)
_. And,_ [_here’s_](/our-methodology-f3d77521a1ee)
 _more information on_ [_PesaCheck’s methodology_](/our-methodology-f3d77521a1ee)
 _for fact-checking questionable content._

_This fact-check was written by PesaCheck fact-checker_ [**_Peris Gachahi_**](https://twitter.com/PerisMimmo)
 _and edited by PesaCheck senior copy editor_ [**_Mary Mutisya_**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/mary-mutisya-522078198/)
 _and chief copy editor_ [**_Stephen Ndegwa_**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/stephen-ndegwa-0b32b126b/)
_._

_The article was approved for publication by PesaCheck managing editor_ [**_Doreen Wainainah_**](https://twitter.com/DoreenWainainah)
**_._**

_PesaCheck is East Africa’s first public finance fact-checking initiative. It was co-founded by_ [**_Catherine Gicheru_**](https://www.icfj.org/our-work/knight/profiles/catherine-gicheru)
 _and_ [**_Justin Arenstein_**](https://www.icfj.org/our-work/knight/profiles/justin-arenstein)
_, and is being incubated by the continent’s largest civic technology and data journalism accelerator:_ [**_Code for Africa_**](https://codeforafrica.org/)
_. It seeks to help the public separate fact from fiction in public pronouncements about the numbers that shape our world, with a special emphasis on pronouncements about public finances that shape government’s delivery of Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) public services, such as healthcare, rural development and access to water / sanitation._ [**_PesaCheck_**](https://pesacheck.org/)
 _also tests the accuracy of media reportage. To find out more about the project, visit_ [**_pesacheck.org_**](https://pesacheck.org/)
**_._**

_PesaCheck is an initiative of_ [**_Code for Africa_**](https://codeforafrica.org/)
_, through its_ [**_innovateAFRICA fund_**](https://innovateafrica.fund/)
_, with support from_ [**_Deutsche Welle Akademie_**](https://www.dw.com/en/dw-akademie/about-us/)
_, in partnership with a coalition of local African media and other civic watchdog organisations._

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image is from 2019 and was featured in a Times of Israel article. The image is of Benjamin Netanyahu’s private residence in Caesarea. The article was published on August 28, 2024, by PesaCheck.

_________________________



SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:53> This image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu's house taken by a Hezbollah drone in August 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:53>)
```

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Times of Israel website contains an article titled "Drones, moans and groans: Hezbollah attacks PM’s home; petty politics continue unintercepted" published on October 21, 2024. The article discusses a drone attack on Benjamin Netanyahu's home in Caesarea. <image:53> is not present in the article.

_________________________



SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:53> This image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu's house taken by a Hezbollah drone in August 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:53>)
```

SummarizeSummariesPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved web sources, each one summarized under "Web Sources". **Your task right now is to summarize the web source summaries.**

Always adhere to the following rules:
* Write only one to two paragraphs.
* Include all URLs from the listed sources. Format them as Markdown hyperlinks.
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the summaries.
* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:53> This image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu's house taken by a Hezbollah drone in August 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:53>)
```

## Web Sources
**Reverse Search Result** The exact image was found in the following sources:

From [Source](https://pesacheck.org/missing-context-this-image-of-israeli-prime-minister-benjamin-netanyahus-home-was-not-captured-by-9d48e97d86b7): Found exact image on website with title: MISSING CONTEXT: This image of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin ...
Content: The image is from 2019 and was featured in a Times of Israel article. The image is of Benjamin Netanyahu’s private residence in Caesarea. The article was published on August 28, 2024, by PesaCheck.


From [Source](https://www.timesofisrael.com/topic/prime-ministers-residence/): Found exact image on website with title: Prime Minister's Residence - The Times of Israel
Content: The Times of Israel website contains an article titled "Drones, moans and groans: Hezbollah attacks PM’s home; petty politics continue unintercepted" published on October 21, 2024. The article discusses a drone attack on Benjamin Netanyahu's home in Caesarea. <image:53> is not present in the article.


From [Source](https://beyondhighbrow.substack.com/): Found exact image on website with title: Beyond Highbrow | Robert Lindsay | Substack
Content: The search result is from the website "Beyond Highbrow" and contains the exact image. The author is Robert Lindsay.


## Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image (<image:53>) is of Benjamin Netanyahu’s private residence in Caesarea. According to a PesaCheck article published on August 28, 2024, the image is from 2019 and was featured in a Times of Israel article ([https://pesacheck.org/missing-context-this-image-of-israeli-prime-minister-benjamin-netanyahus-home-was-not-captured-by-9d48e97d86b7](https://pesacheck.org/missing-context-this-image-of-israeli-prime-minister-benjamin-netanyahus-home-was-not-captured-by-9d48e97d86b7)).

The Times of Israel website ([https://www.timesofisrael.com/topic/prime-ministers-residence/](https://www.timesofisrael.com/topic/prime-ministers-residence/)) published an article on October 21, 2024, discussing a drone attack on Netanyahu's home, but the image is not present in the article. The image was also found on the website "Beyond Highbrow" ([https://beyondhighbrow.substack.com/](https://beyondhighbrow.substack.com/)).

_________________________



DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:53> This image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu's house taken by a Hezbollah drone in August 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:53>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image (<image:53>) is of Benjamin Netanyahu’s private residence in Caesarea. According to a PesaCheck article published on August 28, 2024, the image is from 2019 and was featured in a Times of Israel article ([https://pesacheck.org/missing-context-this-image-of-israeli-prime-minister-benjamin-netanyahus-home-was-not-captured-by-9d48e97d86b7](https://pesacheck.org/missing-context-this-image-of-israeli-prime-minister-benjamin-netanyahus-home-was-not-captured-by-9d48e97d86b7)).

The Times of Israel website ([https://www.timesofisrael.com/topic/prime-ministers-residence/](https://www.timesofisrael.com/topic/prime-ministers-residence/)) published an article on October 21, 2024, discussing a drone attack on Netanyahu's home, but the image is not present in the article. The image was also found on the website "Beyond Highbrow" ([https://beyondhighbrow.substack.com/](https://beyondhighbrow.substack.com/)).


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image is of Benjamin Netanyahu's private residence in Caesarea. However, the image is from 2019, not August 2024, as claimed. The image was featured in a Times of Israel article.

The claim that the image was taken by a Hezbollah drone is not supported by the evidence. The Times of Israel published an article on October 21, 2024, discussing a drone attack on Netanyahu's home, but the image is not present in the article.

_________________________



JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:53> This image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu's house taken by a Hezbollah drone in August 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:53>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image (<image:53>) is of Benjamin Netanyahu’s private residence in Caesarea. According to a PesaCheck article published on August 28, 2024, the image is from 2019 and was featured in a Times of Israel article ([https://pesacheck.org/missing-context-this-image-of-israeli-prime-minister-benjamin-netanyahus-home-was-not-captured-by-9d48e97d86b7](https://pesacheck.org/missing-context-this-image-of-israeli-prime-minister-benjamin-netanyahus-home-was-not-captured-by-9d48e97d86b7)).

The Times of Israel website ([https://www.timesofisrael.com/topic/prime-ministers-residence/](https://www.timesofisrael.com/topic/prime-ministers-residence/)) published an article on October 21, 2024, discussing a drone attack on Netanyahu's home, but the image is not present in the article. The image was also found on the website "Beyond Highbrow" ([https://beyondhighbrow.substack.com/](https://beyondhighbrow.substack.com/)).


## Elaboration
The image is of Benjamin Netanyahu's private residence in Caesarea. However, the image is from 2019, not August 2024, as claimed. The image was featured in a Times of Israel article.

The claim that the image was taken by a Hezbollah drone is not supported by the evidence. The Times of Israel published an article on October 21, 2024, discussing a drone attack on Netanyahu's home, but the image is not present in the article.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image is of Benjamin Netanyahu's house, but it is from 2019, not August 2024. The claim that the image was taken by a Hezbollah drone is not supported by the evidence.

The claim is demonstrably false because the image is from 2019 and not taken by a Hezbollah drone. `false`

_________________________



SummarizeDocPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You are provided with the record of a fact-check. It contains the Claim to be verified and a documentation of all the fact-checking work along the gathered evidence. Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:53> This image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu's house taken by a Hezbollah drone in August 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:53>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image (<image:53>) is of Benjamin Netanyahu’s private residence in Caesarea. According to a PesaCheck article published on August 28, 2024, the image is from 2019 and was featured in a Times of Israel article ([https://pesacheck.org/missing-context-this-image-of-israeli-prime-minister-benjamin-netanyahus-home-was-not-captured-by-9d48e97d86b7](https://pesacheck.org/missing-context-this-image-of-israeli-prime-minister-benjamin-netanyahus-home-was-not-captured-by-9d48e97d86b7)).

The Times of Israel website ([https://www.timesofisrael.com/topic/prime-ministers-residence/](https://www.timesofisrael.com/topic/prime-ministers-residence/)) published an article on October 21, 2024, discussing a drone attack on Netanyahu's home, but the image is not present in the article. The image was also found on the website "Beyond Highbrow" ([https://beyondhighbrow.substack.com/](https://beyondhighbrow.substack.com/)).


## Elaboration
The image is of Benjamin Netanyahu's private residence in Caesarea. However, the image is from 2019, not August 2024, as claimed. The image was featured in a Times of Israel article.

The claim that the image was taken by a Hezbollah drone is not supported by the evidence. The Times of Israel published an article on October 21, 2024, discussing a drone attack on Netanyahu's home, but the image is not present in the article.


## Final Judgement
The image is of Benjamin Netanyahu's house, but it is from 2019, not August 2024. The claim that the image was taken by a Hezbollah drone is not supported by the evidence.

The claim is demonstrably false because the image is from 2019 and not taken by a Hezbollah drone. `false`


## Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image depicts Benjamin Netanyahu's residence, but it was taken in 2019, not August 2024, as the claim states. Furthermore, there is no evidence to support the claim that the image was captured by a Hezbollah drone. The image was featured in a Times of Israel article ([https://pesacheck.org/missing-context-this-image-of-israeli-prime-minister-benjamin-netanyahus-home-was-not-captured-by-9d48e97d86b7](https://pesacheck.org/missing-context-this-image-of-israeli-prime-minister-benjamin-netanyahus-home-was-not-captured-by-9d48e97d86b7)).

_________________________



PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Example: reverse_search()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a rare event of a solar eclipse with a double ring."

...

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:k>)
```

# Record
## Claim

===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
```
reverse_search(<image:54>)
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background.

NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/channel-12-poll-shows-liberman-still-holds-the-key-to-netanyahus-next-coalition/): Found exact image on website with title: Channel 12 poll shows Liberman still holds the key to Netanyahu's ...
Content: "[Skip to main content](#main-content)

Advertisement

Homepage

A Channel 12 election poll shows a neck-and-neck race between Likud and Blue and White — and to Netanyahu’s boundless frustration, the deciding vote is in the hands of Avigdor Liberman’s Yisrael Beytenu party.

The poll’s numbers, if the election is held today:

Likud – 31  
Blue and White – 30  
Arab parties, if they unite – 11  
Yisrael Beytenu – 10  
United Torah Judaism – 8  
Shas – 7  
Labor – 6  
New Right – 5  
Union of Right-wing Parties – 4  
Meretz – 4  
Ehud Barak’s Israel Democratic Party – 4  
Zehut – 0 (at 1.7% of votes, it falls under the 3.25% electoral threshold)

That puts a comfortable right-wing coalition (Likud, UTJ, Shas, New Right, URWP) at 55 seats, not a majority in the 120-seat Knesset — and hands Yisrael Beytenu the 10-seat swing vote.

Netanyahu and Liberman are bitter rivals after the latter’s demands on religion-and-state issues robbed Netanyahu of a coalition following the April 9 election.

Channel 12 also looked at the effect of a unified left-wing bloc of Labor, Israel Democratic Party and Meretz. The union took 15 seats, more than the 14 the parties garnered separately — and cost Blue and White two seats, dropping the larger centrist party to 28. Likud was unchanged at 31.

A union on the far-right would also have an effect. If Ayelet Shaked, the popular former justice minister, were to lead the URWP in a joint list with New Right, the combined faction would draw 12 seats, three more than the two parties separately — and rob Likud of three, driving it down to 28.

* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)

* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.

# Search Result

Content: "Share

Digital manipulation distorts Israeli TV poll
=============================================

James McManagan August 08, 2024

!31f67f1a 22e7 49c4 ab56 680e7bae2cce <image:12292>

An image of a 2022 TV station poll has been digitally manipulated. Image by N12/AAP

**WHAT WAS CLAIMED**

Nearly half of respondents to an Israeli TV station's poll said a soldier should be allowed to rape a prisoner.

**OUR VERDICT**

False. An image of an unrelated poll result has been manipulated.

AAP FACTCHECK – Forty-seven per cent of people polled by an Israeli TV station agree that a soldier should be allowed to rape a prisoner, social media posts claim.

This is false. An image of a News 12 poll has been digitally manipulated. The actual 2022 poll referred to an unrelated question.

Various [social media posts](https://archive.md/R9ZR5)
 feature a still image from a [News 12](https://www.mako.co.il/news-channel12?subChannelId=b91e54300a2ef710VgnVCM200000650a10acRCRD&vcmid=622e1dba8a601810VgnVCM200000650a10acRCRD)
 broadcast in which a presenter is pictured revealing the results of a poll.

A blue box with Hebrew text has been added to the top right of the image. It translates as: "Do you agree with the claim that a soldier is allowed to rape a terrorist?"

!Social media post with Fake poll on Israel rape <image:12293>

Many social media posts incorporate the fake image. (Facebook/AAP)

The poll results are shown below, with 47 per cent for yes and 43 per cent for no.

"Wow, the majority said yes. And western government \[sic\] are supporting these monsters!", one post's caption <image:12294>
 reads, while [another says](https://archive.md/wip/toJEQ)
: "Even thinking that conducting this poll is appropriate makes me sick."

The poll can be traced back to a real segment from the Israeli news channel in May 2022 ([one minute 50 seconds](https://www.mako.co.il/news-channel12?subChannelId=b91e54300a2ef710VgnVCM200000650a10acRCRD&vcmid=622e1dba8a601810VgnVCM200000650a10acRCRD)
).

In the genuine broadcast footage, the question displayed reads: "Do you agree with the claim that the government relies on terrorist supporters?"

In the image shared on social media, the blue box overlays the screen, obscuring the original question, which appears along with the results on a screen behind the presenter.

!Fake image next to real image of faked Israel rape poll. <image:12295>

Seen side by side, it's clear the second image is a doctored version of the first (the original). (N12/Facebook/AAP)

The false claim and image follow reports of footage showing [alleged sexual abuse](https://www.jpost.com/israel-news/article-813732)
 of Palestinian detainees by the Israel Defense Forces (IDF).

On Wednesday, August 7, the US State Department urged the IDF to fully investigate the allegations.

**The Verdict**

**False** – The claim is inaccurate.

AAP FactCheck is an accredited member of the [International Fact-Checking Network](https://www.poynter.org/ifcn/)
. To keep up with our latest fact checks, follow us on [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/AAPFactCheck)
, [Twitter](https://twitter.com/AapFactcheck)
 and [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/aapfactcheck/)
.

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search result from AAP, published on August 08, 2024, fact-checks a claim that nearly half of respondents to an Israeli TV station's poll said a soldier should be allowed to rape a prisoner. The AAP found the claim to be false, stating that the image of the poll was digitally manipulated. The original poll, from May 2022, asked about the government's reliance on terrorist supporters. <image:12292>, <image:12293>, <image:12294>, <image:12295>.

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:54> The image shows a screenshot of an authentic question from Israel's Channel 12 public opinion poll: 'Do you agree with the claim that a solder is allowed to rape a prisoner with his hands tied?'"

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:54>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image <image:54> appears in articles from The Times of Israel ([https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/channel-12-poll-shows-liberman-still-holds-the-key-to-netanyahus-next-coalition/](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/channel-12-poll-shows-liberman-still-holds-the-key-to-netanyahus-next-coalition/)) and Haaretz ([https://www.haaretz.com/ty-tag/yigal-amir-0000017f-da25-d718-a5ff-faa5f9030000](https://www.haaretz.com/ty-tag/yigal-amir-0000017f-da25-d718-a5ff-faa5f9030000)). The AAP ([https://www.aap.com.au/factcheck/digital-manipulation-distorts-israeli-tv-poll/](https://www.aap.com.au/factcheck/digital-manipulation-distorts-israeli-tv-poll/)) fact-checked the image and found it to be digitally manipulated. The original poll, from May 2022, asked about the government's reliance on terrorist supporters.


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence indicates that the image is a screenshot of a poll from Israel's Channel 12. However, the AAP fact-checked the image and found it to be digitally manipulated. The original poll's question was different from the one presented in the image.

Therefore, the claim that the image shows an authentic question about a soldier being allowed to rape a prisoner is false.

_________________________



JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:54> The image shows a screenshot of an authentic question from Israel's Channel 12 public opinion poll: 'Do you agree with the claim that a solder is allowed to rape a prisoner with his hands tied?'"

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:54>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image <image:54> appears in articles from The Times of Israel ([https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/channel-12-poll-shows-liberman-still-holds-the-key-to-netanyahus-next-coalition/](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/channel-12-poll-shows-liberman-still-holds-the-key-to-netanyahus-next-coalition/)) and Haaretz ([https://www.haaretz.com/ty-tag/yigal-amir-0000017f-da25-d718-a5ff-faa5f9030000](https://www.haaretz.com/ty-tag/yigal-amir-0000017f-da25-d718-a5ff-faa5f9030000)). The AAP ([https://www.aap.com.au/factcheck/digital-manipulation-distorts-israeli-tv-poll/](https://www.aap.com.au/factcheck/digital-manipulation-distorts-israeli-tv-poll/)) fact-checked the image and found it to be digitally manipulated. The original poll, from May 2022, asked about the government's reliance on terrorist supporters.


## Elaboration
The evidence indicates that the image is a screenshot of a poll from Israel's Channel 12. However, the AAP fact-checked the image and found it to be digitally manipulated. The original poll's question was different from the one presented in the image.

Therefore, the claim that the image shows an authentic question about a soldier being allowed to rape a prisoner is false.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image is a screenshot of a poll from Israel's Channel 12, but it has been digitally manipulated. The original poll's question was different from the one presented in the image.

`false`
_________________________



SummarizeDocPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You are provided with the record of a fact-check. It contains the Claim to be verified and a documentation of all the fact-checking work along the gathered evidence. Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:54> The image shows a screenshot of an authentic question from Israel's Channel 12 public opinion poll: 'Do you agree with the claim that a solder is allowed to rape a prisoner with his hands tied?'"

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:54>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image <image:54> appears in articles from The Times of Israel ([https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/channel-12-poll-shows-liberman-still-holds-the-key-to-netanyahus-next-coalition/](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/channel-12-poll-shows-liberman-still-holds-the-key-to-netanyahus-next-coalition/)) and Haaretz ([https://www.haaretz.com/ty-tag/yigal-amir-0000017f-da25-d718-a5ff-faa5f9030000](https://www.haaretz.com/ty-tag/yigal-amir-0000017f-da25-d718-a5ff-faa5f9030000)). The AAP ([https://www.aap.com.au/factcheck/digital-manipulation-distorts-israeli-tv-poll/](https://www.aap.com.au/factcheck/digital-manipulation-distorts-israeli-tv-poll/)) fact-checked the image and found it to be digitally manipulated. The original poll, from May 2022, asked about the government's reliance on terrorist supporters.


## Elaboration
The evidence indicates that the image is a screenshot of a poll from Israel's Channel 12. However, the AAP fact-checked the image and found it to be digitally manipulated. The original poll's question was different from the one presented in the image.

Therefore, the claim that the image shows an authentic question about a soldier being allowed to rape a prisoner is false.


## Final Judgement
The image is a screenshot of a poll from Israel's Channel 12, but it has been digitally manipulated. The original poll's question was different from the one presented in the image.

`false`

## Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image is a screenshot of a poll from Israel's Channel 12, but it has been digitally manipulated. The original poll's question was different from the one presented in the image, as confirmed by the AAP fact-check ([https://www.aap.com.au/factcheck/digital-manipulation-distorts-israeli-tv-poll/](https://www.aap.com.au/factcheck/digital-manipulation-distorts-israeli-tv-poll/)).

_________________________



PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Example: reverse_search()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a rare event of a solar eclipse with a double ring."

...

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:k>)
```

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:56> This image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu inside his office and was captured and published by Hezbollah in August 2024."

# Your Actions



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
```
reverse_search(<image:56>)
```
_________________________



SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:56> This image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu inside his office and was captured and published by Hezbollah in August 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:56>)
```

# Search Result
From [Source](https://pesacheck.org/altered-this-photo-of-a-drone-surveilling-pm-netanyahu-is-fabricated-396f43e817da): Found exact image on website with title: ALTERED: This photo of a drone surveilling PM Netanyahu is ...

Citizens need accurate information to make sound decisions. PesaCheck is Africa’s largest indigenous fact-checking organisation, debunking misleading claims and deciphering the often confusing numbers quoted by public figures in 16 African countries.

ALTERED: This photo of a drone surveilling PM Netanyahu is fabricated
=====================================================================

**The authentic photo of the Israeli PM Netanyahu is from 2009.**
-----------------------------------------------------------------

[![PesaCheck](https://miro.medium.com/v2/resize:fill:64:64/0*ttzO0bKO1LLBQdao.jpg)](https://medium.com/@PesaCheck?source=post_page---byline--396f43e817da---------------------------------------)

[PesaCheck](https://medium.com/@PesaCheck?source=post_page---byline--396f43e817da---------------------------------------)

Listen

Share

A [photo published on X](https://archive.is/0PvDl)
 (formerly Twitter) claiming to show Israeli Prime Minister (PM) Benjamin Netanyahu being surveilled by Iran from inside his office is ALTERED.

The post alleges that Iran’s Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) captured and published the image, accompanied by a warning reading, “Do not test our capabilities — we intend to keep you living in a state of constant anxiety!”

However, a reverse image search revealed that the photo has [been online](https://archive.is/JmjZG)
 since 2019 and was not shared by IRGC in 2025, as the post claims.

Furthermore, a Yandex image search showed that the photo was [edited](https://www.malumatfurus.org/netanyahu-makam-odasi/)
 to make it appear as though Netanyahu was under surveillance. The [original image](https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/news-photo/in-this-handout-photo-benjamin-netanyahu-head-of-the-right-news-photo/84719768?adppopup=true)
, taken on 8 February 2009, in Jerusalem, shows Netanyahu with his father, Ben Zion Netanyahu.

A FotoForensics Error Level Analysis (ELA) reveals that the photo has been altered, as indicated by inconsistencies and noise in the image.

PesaCheck has looked into a photo on X (formerly Twitter) claiming to show Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu being surveilled by Iran from inside his office and finds it to have been ALTERED.

_This post is part of an ongoing series of PesaCheck fact-checks examining content marked as_ **_potential misinformation_** _on Facebook and other social media platforms._

[_By partnering with Facebook and similar social media platforms_](/pesacheck-and-facebook-partner-to-fight-misinformation-in-kenya-d6a45ee70c18?gi=d2cb1ae7440)
_, third-party fact-checking organisations like PesaCheck are helping to sort fact from fiction. We do this by giving the public deeper insight and context to posts they see in their social media feeds._

_Have you spotted what you think is fake or false information on Facebook?_ [_Here’s how you can report_](https://www.facebook.com/help/572838089565953?helpref=faq_content)
_. And,_ [_here’s_](/our-methodology-f3d77521a1ee)
 _more information on_ [_PesaCheck’s methodology_](/our-methodology-f3d77521a1ee)
 _for fact-checking questionable content._

_This fact-check was written by Senior PesaCheck fact-checker_ [**_Pius Enywaru_**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/enywaru/)
 _and edited by PesaCheck copy editor_ [**_Paul Tajuba_**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/paul-tajuba-93b62a82/)
 _and_ _chief copy editor_ [**_Stephen Ndegwa_**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/stephen-ndegwa-0b32b126b/)
**_._**

_The article was approved for publication by PesaCheck managing editor_ [**_Doreen Wainainah_**](https://twitter.com/DoreenWainainah)
**_._**

_PesaCheck is East Africa’s first public finance fact-checking initiative. It was co-founded by_ [**_Catherine Gicheru_**](https://www.icfj.org/our-work/knight/profiles/catherine-gicheru)
 _and_ [**_Justin Arenstein_**](https://www.icfj.org/our-work/knight/profiles/justin-arenstein)
_, and is being incubated by the continent’s largest civic technology and data journalism accelerator:_ [**_Code for Africa_**](https://codeforafrica.org/)
_. It seeks to help the public separate fact from fiction in public pronouncements about the numbers that shape our world, with a special emphasis on pronouncements about public finances that shape government’s delivery of Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) public services, such as healthcare, rural development and access to water / sanitation._ [**_PesaCheck_**](https://pesacheck.org/)
 _also tests the accuracy of media reportage. To find out more about the project, visit_ [**_pesacheck.org_**](https://pesacheck.org/)
_._

[_Email Us_](mailto:info@pesacheck.org)

[_WhatsApp Us_](https://api.whatsapp.com/send/?phone=254780542626&text=&type=phone_number&app_absent=0)

_PesaCheck is an initiative of_ [**_Code for Africa_**](https://codeforafrica.org/)
_, through its_ [**_innovateAFRICA fund_**](https://innovateafrica.fund/)
_, with support from_ [**_Deutsche Welle Akademie_**](https://www.dw.com/en/dw-akademie/about-us/)
_, in partnership with a coalition of local African media and other civic watchdog organisations._

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search result from PesaCheck states that the image <image:56> is fabricated. The original photo was taken in 2009 and shows Benjamin Netanyahu with his father. The article was published 1 day ago.

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:56> This image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu inside his office and was captured and published by Hezbollah in August 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:56>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
From [Source](https://pesacheck.org/altered-this-photo-of-a-drone-surveilling-pm-netanyahu-is-fabricated-396f43e817da): Found exact image on website with title: ALTERED: This photo of a drone surveilling PM Netanyahu is ...
Content: The search result from PesaCheck states that the image <image:56> is fabricated. The original photo was taken in 2009 and shows Benjamin Netanyahu with his father. The article was published 1 day ago.


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image is fabricated. The original photo was taken in 2009 and shows Benjamin Netanyahu with his father.

_________________________



JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:56> This image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu inside his office and was captured and published by Hezbollah in August 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:56>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
From [Source](https://pesacheck.org/altered-this-photo-of-a-drone-surveilling-pm-netanyahu-is-fabricated-396f43e817da): Found exact image on website with title: ALTERED: This photo of a drone surveilling PM Netanyahu is ...
Content: The search result from PesaCheck states that the image <image:56> is fabricated. The original photo was taken in 2009 and shows Benjamin Netanyahu with his father. The article was published 1 day ago.


## Elaboration
The image is fabricated. The original photo was taken in 2009 and shows Benjamin Netanyahu with his father.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image is fabricated. The original photo was taken in 2009 and shows Benjamin Netanyahu with his father. The claim that the image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu inside his office and was captured and published by Hezbollah in August 2024 is therefore false.

`false`
_________________________



SummarizeDocPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You are provided with the record of a fact-check. It contains the Claim to be verified and a documentation of all the fact-checking work along the gathered evidence. Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:56> This image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu inside his office and was captured and published by Hezbollah in August 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:56>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
From [Source](https://pesacheck.org/altered-this-photo-of-a-drone-surveilling-pm-netanyahu-is-fabricated-396f43e817da): Found exact image on website with title: ALTERED: This photo of a drone surveilling PM Netanyahu is ...
Content: The search result from PesaCheck states that the image <image:56> is fabricated. The original photo was taken in 2009 and shows Benjamin Netanyahu with his father. The article was published 1 day ago.


## Elaboration
The image is fabricated. The original photo was taken in 2009 and shows Benjamin Netanyahu with his father.


## Final Judgement
The image is fabricated. The original photo was taken in 2009 and shows Benjamin Netanyahu with his father. The claim that the image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu inside his office and was captured and published by Hezbollah in August 2024 is therefore false.

`false`

## Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image depicting Benjamin Netanyahu was fabricated, as confirmed by a reverse image search. The original photo, taken in 2009, shows Netanyahu with his father, thus disproving the claim that the image was captured and published by Hezbollah in August 2024, as reported by [PesaCheck](https://pesacheck.org/altered-this-photo-of-a-drone-surveilling-pm-netanyahu-is-fabricated-396f43e817da).

_________________________



PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Example: reverse_search()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a rare event of a solar eclipse with a double ring."

...

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:k>)
```

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:57> This is an authentic image of Esmail Qaani, the commander of the Iranian Revolutionary Guards, disguised in a hijab in fear of Israeli bombing."

# Your Actions



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
```
reverse_search(<image:57>)
```
_________________________



SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:57> This is an authentic image of Esmail Qaani, the commander of the Iranian Revolutionary Guards, disguised in a hijab in fear of Israeli bombing."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:57>)
```

| **"From Commander to Ghost: Qaani’s Great Escape?"**  <br>  <br>  <br><br>> The X post by @MOSSADil  <br>> juxtaposes two images of Esmail Qaani, commander of Iran's IRGC Quds Force, showing him in official military attire and later in civilian disguise, hinting at an escape or survival tactic following reported Israeli airstrikes in June 2025, which The New York Times claimed killed him—yet his reappearance challenges that narrative.  <br>>   <br>> Historical context reveals Qaani’s role expanded after Qasem Soleimani’s 2020 assassination, with him overseeing extraterritorial operations and financial support to groups like Hezbollah, making him a high-value target; his survival suggests advanced evasion strategies, possibly informed by Iran’s experience with past Mossad operations.  <br>>   <br>> No peer-reviewed studies directly address this event, but intelligence analysis from sources like the Institute for National Security Studies indicates Israel’s use of AI and drones in recent strikes, implying Qaani’s escape may reflect counterintelligence adaptations to such technology, a development not yet widely acknowledged in mainstream reports.  <br>>   <br><br>[https://x.com/MOSSADil/status/1937910103413305647?t=U-jJJCUJfAiMFHTQUo7QSw&s=08](https://x.com/MOSSADil/status/1937910103413305647?t=U-jJJCUJfAiMFHTQUo7QSw&s=08)<br><br>**2 Likes**<br><br>([Share⤴](#)<br>)<br><br>*   ![](/static/copypost.svg/3)Copy Post<br><br>* * *<br><br>*   ![](/static/whatsapp.svg/3)WhatsApp<br><br>* * *<br><br>*   ![](/static/telegram.svg/3)Telegram<br><br>* * *<br><br>*   ![](/static/twitter.svg/3)Twitter<br><br>* * *<br><br>*   ![](/static/facebook.svg/3)Facebook<br><br>![](https://www.nairaland.com/attachments/19372980_screenshot20250626135815x_jpeg6f297ae460a3af6b763a91ab2860e060)<br><br>![](https://www.nairaland.com/attachments/19372981_20250626135822_jpegc08e73ef887b6ca54a330b84be6c0905)<br><br>![](https://www.nairaland.com/attachments/19372982_20250626135825_jpeg180b82528e58725485b2e7c2d1d64386)<br><br>![](https://www.nairaland.com/attachments/19372983_20250626135832_jpegdff47f83bbe7b7ca12d42dcd0cbca00f) |

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search result is from Nairaland, a Nigerian forum. It discusses an image of Esmail Qaani, the commander of the Iranian Revolutionary Guards, in disguise. The post suggests that the disguise was a survival tactic following reported Israeli airstrikes. The post also includes a link to an X post by @MOSSADil, which juxtaposes two images of Qaani, one in military attire and the other in civilian disguise. <image:57> The forum post also contains several comments from users discussing the situation.

_________________________



DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:57> This is an authentic image of Esmail Qaani, the commander of the Iranian Revolutionary Guards, disguised in a hijab in fear of Israeli bombing."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:57>)
```

## Evidence

Content: The search result is from Nairaland, a Nigerian forum. It discusses an image of Esmail Qaani, the commander of the Iranian Revolutionary Guards, in disguise. The post suggests that the disguise was a survival tactic following reported Israeli airstrikes. The post also includes a link to an X post by @MOSSADil, which juxtaposes two images of Qaani, one in military attire and the other in civilian disguise. <image:57> The forum post also contains several comments from users discussing the situation.


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence suggests that the image is of Esmail Qaani, the commander of the Iranian Revolutionary Guards, in disguise. The Nairaland forum post, which includes the image, discusses the disguise as a survival tactic following reported Israeli airstrikes. The post also links to an X post that juxtaposes images of Qaani in military attire and civilian disguise.

The evidence does not explicitly confirm the claim that the disguise was due to fear of Israeli bombing, but it does suggest this as a possible reason.

Further information is needed to verify the claim definitively, such as official statements or reports confirming the reason for the disguise.

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.
