# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-61976009): 
Content: "<image:13436>!YOAV LEMMER/AFP via Getty Images Image shows woman holding up picture of Hisham al-Sayed <image:13437>YOAV LEMMER/AFP via Getty Images

Hisham al-Sayed's mother holds up a photograph of her son in April 2016

**Palestinian militant group Hamas has released a video appearing to show an Israeli citizen being held captive in the Gaza Strip.**

The clip appears to show Hisham al-Sayed lying in a bed looking dazed and wearing an oxygen mask - the first sighting of him since 2015.

Israeli Prime Minister Naftali Bennett said releasing a video of a sick man was "reprehensible and desperate."

The BBC has not been able to independently verify the footage.

Hamas alleges that Mr al-Sayed is an Israeli soldier, but both the Israeli government and his family say he is a civilian with mental health problems.

The charity Human Rights Watch, which has criticised Mr al-Sayed's "unlawful detention" in the past, says he was last seen walking into the Gaza Strip in April 2015 for unknown reasons, having made similar attempts to cross the frontier in the past.

In the video released by Hamas the 34-year-old, who is a member of Israel's Bedouin Arab minority, could be seen lying attached to a ventilator beside what appeared to be his Israeli-issued ID card.

A television monitor also in the room showed news footage from an economic conference in Qatar earlier this month.

No further details were given by the Palestinian militant group about the detainee's condition other than a reference on Monday to his health having deteriorated.

Israel says he is one of two citizens, the second being Avera Mengistu, currently being held captive by Hamas in violation of international law.

Both are believed to have crossed willingly into the Gaza Strip despite Israel banning its citizens from entering the Palestinian enclave.

There was some suggestion that the video's release was an attempt by Hamas to pressure Israel into resuming prisoner swap negotiations.

The two sides have engaged in prisoner swaps in the past, most notably in 2011 when abducted Israeli soldier Gilad Shalit was released in exchange for more than 1,000 Palestinians held in Israeli jails.

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/devoted-palestinian-son-steals-mother-s-body-bury-her-way-n1242126): 
Content: "Despite being in isolation, she had a daily visitor.

Her son, Jihad Al Suwaiti, 32, scaled the hospital building each day to sit outside her window and check that she was wearing her oxygen mask — an act that unwittingly catapulted him into the global spotlight after a picture of him sitting outside his mother’s window that his brother posted on Facebook went viral.

Before long, Jihad’s story had traveled the world, and a video even emerged of an imam in Sudan during prayers referencing him as an example of how all [Muslims](https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/saudi-arabia-umrah-pilgrims-return-mecca-stilled-covid-19-slump-n1242033)
 should treat their mothers.

![Image: Jihad Al Suwaiti's mother, Rasmiye Suwaiti.](https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_fit-760w,f_auto,q_auto:best/newscms/2020_39/3414924/200925-palestine-mum-mc-13203.JPG)

Jihad Al Suwaiti's mother, 73-year-old Rasmiye Suwaiti.Jam Press / Jam Press

His dedication didn’t stop there: When his mother died on July 17, Jihad and his siblings stole her body after hospital staff said they couldn’t release it to the family.

Brothers, nephews and friends came in seven different cars in a plan devised to distract and confuse the ambulance drivers who chased the brothers as they stole their mother’s body, he said.

The ambulance drivers lost track of which car was carrying the body and the brothers successfully took their mother back to Beit Awwa, he said.

Tarek al Barbarawi, director of Alia hospital in [Hebron](https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/hebrons-ghost-town-last-life-last-palestinian-boy-street-n373531)
 where Rasmiye was being treated, confirmed to NBC News that her body was stolen because her children did not want her body to be wrapped in plastic.

Muslim tradition holds that the dead should be buried as soon as possible, with the body wrapped in a white shroud. Even when she asked, he would not tell her she had cancer but instead said she was getting treatment for her feet.

As her health deteriorated with the coronavirus, Jihad would watch her from her window ledge to make sure she was taking in oxygen.

Asked about the now-famous picture of him scaling the hospital wall to see his mother in her final days, Jihad said the moment the doctors left the room, he would climb through the window and sit by her bed protected only by a mask and gloves.

“If I left her for one second, she would take off her oxygen mask,” he said.

In her last moments, as death began to take her, she muttered.

“‘I want to sleep at Jihad’s house. For an optimal experience visit our site on another browser.

Skip to Content

![Image: Jihad Al Suwaiti](https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_fit-560w,f_auto,q_auto:best/newscms/2020_41/3414925/200925-palestine-mum-mc-1320.JPG)

Jihad Al Suwaiti scaled a hospital building in the West Bank to watch over his mother from day and night until she died due to the coronavirus.Jam Press

*   [](https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/devoted-palestinian-son-steals-mother-s-body-bury-her-way-n1242126&cid=[object Object]_facebook)

*   [](sms:?&body=After Covid took their mother, sons take her body from hospital to grant her dying wish via nbcnews - https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/devoted-palestinian-son-steals-mother-s-body-bury-her-way-n1242126)
    

Oct. But earlier this year, new decrees for handling the coronavirus dead were given for Muslim burials, according to Sheikh Muhammad Hussein, Grand Mufti of Jerusalem and the Palestinian Territories.

“This is a rule of necessity and necessities allow for prohibitions, therefore the deceased is not washed, nor shrouded and is buried in a plastic body-bag,” Hussein [told Reuters.](https://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-health-coronavirus-israel-palestinian/death-in-the-holy-land-coronavirus-changes-burial-for-jews-muslims-idUKKBN21K0QE)

“She said, ‘If I die because of this disease, don’t bury me in a plastic bag!’” recalled Jihad, the youngest of her nine children.

“I held her with my own hands, dug her grave and buried her the way she asked me to,” he said.

So far Jihad has faced no sanction for breaking the law and putting others at risk.

Born in 1947 in the hilly [Palestinian](https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/uae-makes-nice-israel-palestinians-decry-betrayal-n1236718)
 town of Beit Awwa in the occupied West Bank, Rasmiye Al Suwaiti is one of the 387 people to have died in the West Bank and Gaza since the start of the pandemic, from a total of 44,684 cases, according to [Johns Hopkins University](https://coronavirus.jhu.edu/map.html)
.

Those who knew her described her as a simple woman who never learned to read or write but had an unparalleled zeal for life and a heart overflowing with love.

“She had the entire world’s kindness in her heart,” Jihad said.

![Image: Jihad Al SuwaIti](https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_fit-760w,f_auto,q_auto:best/newscms/2020_39/3414923/200925-palestine-mum-mc-13202.JPG)

Jihad Al Suwaiti scales the hospital building. Hisham would look after the flock, and from the milk, Rasmiye would make yogurt, labneh and cheese that they would sell, along with the olives and oil, at markets in Beit Awwa.

Once home, they would share the household chores, and their father would help the children study because Rasmiye could not read or write, Riham said.

By their children’s accounts, their life was happy even as the [Israeli-Palestinian conflict](https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/trump-peace-plan-will-likely-extend-decades-old-conflict-analysts-n1125456)
 waxed and waned around them.

### The family bond

Following her husband’s death, Rasmiye spent the rest of her life in mourning, Riham said. By the end of May, the Palestinian Authority’s strict measures appeared to have paid off, with around 450 confirmed cases and just three deaths in the kidney-shaped territory, according to the authority’s figures. She has covered the Middle East conflict — on both the Israeli and Palestinian sides — for more than a decade. 

[Saphora Smith](https://www.nbcnews.com/author/saphora-smith-ncpn737061)

Saphora Smith was a former U.K."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The NBC News article, published on September 25, 2020, discusses a Palestinian man named Jihad Al Suwaiti, who scaled a hospital building to be near his mother, Rasmiye Suwaiti, who was being treated for COVID-19. <image:1>, <image:2>, <image:3>. The article also mentions that after his mother's death, Jihad and his siblings took her body from the hospital to bury her according to Muslim tradition.

_________________________

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:61> This image shows a Palestinian girl in the Gaza war in July 2024. She was holding her sister's oxygen mask inside the ambulance. She had already passed away, yet her hand remained on the mask firmly."

## Actions
```

```

```
web_search("Palestinian girl oxygen mask")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
Al Jazeera published an article on January 15, 2025, featuring images from the 15-month war in Gaza, including images from November 2023 to September 2024, depicting destruction and suffering (<image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>, <image:l>, <image:m>, <image:n>, <image:o>, <image:p>, <image:q>). Getty Images provides images related to the Gaza war, including displaced Palestinians and the aftermath of bombings, with images from October 2023 and August 2025 (<image:13422>).

CNN published an article on October 5, 2024, featuring images from the Israel-Hamas war, including airstrikes and the aftermath of the conflict, with images of a woman holding a baby and medics tending to an injured infant (<image:i>, <image:j>).


### Evidence from `web_search`

# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The provided evidence includes articles and images related to the Gaza war, including images of destruction, suffering, and medical care. The NPR article specifically mentions a baby girl in Gaza who died after her mother was killed in an airstrike. However, none of the search results provide information that directly supports the claim about the image of the Palestinian girl holding her sister's oxygen mask.

The claim states the image was taken in July 2024. The search results include images from the Gaza war, but none of them match the image in the claim. Therefore, I cannot verify the claim.

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

## Claim

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

CNN published an article on October 5, 2024, featuring images from the Israel-Hamas war, including airstrikes and the aftermath of the conflict, with images of a woman holding a baby and medics tending to an injured infant (<image:i>, <image:j>).


### Evidence from `web_search`
The NPR article ([https://www.npr.org/2024/04/26/1247453317/gaza-baby-girl-mother-killed-israel-airstrike](https://www.npr.org/2024/04/26/1247453317/gaza-baby-girl-mother-killed-israel-airstrike)) discusses a baby girl in Gaza who died after her mother was killed in an Israeli airstrike, including images of the baby in an incubator <image:13430>

## Elaboration
The provided evidence includes articles and images related to the Gaza war, including images of destruction, suffering, and medical care. The NPR article specifically mentions a baby girl in Gaza who died after her mother was killed in an airstrike. However, none of the search results provide information that directly supports the claim about the image of the Palestinian girl holding her sister's oxygen mask.

The claim states the image was taken in July 2024. The search results include images from the Gaza war, but none of them match the image in the claim. Therefore, I cannot verify the claim.


## Actions
```
image_search("Palestinian girl holding oxygen mask Gaza war")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `image_search`
The image search revealed that the image <image:61>

# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image search did not yield any information to verify the claim. Therefore, I cannot verify the claim.

_________________________



JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

SummarizeDocPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You are provided with the record of a fact-check. It contains the Claim to be verified and a documentation of all the fact-checking work along the gathered evidence. Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:61> This image shows a Palestinian girl in the Gaza war in July 2024. She was holding her sister's oxygen mask inside the ambulance. She had already passed away, yet her hand remained on the mask firmly."

Getty Images provides images related to the Gaza war, including displaced Palestinians and the aftermath of bombings, with images from October 2023 and August 2025 (<image:13422>).

CNN published an article on October 5, 2024, featuring images from the Israel-Hamas war, including airstrikes and the aftermath of the conflict, with images of a woman holding a baby and medics tending to an injured infant (<image:i>, <image:j>).


### Evidence from `web_search`
The NPR article ([https://www.npr.org/2024/04/26/1247453317/gaza-baby-girl-mother-killed-israel-airstrike](https://www.npr.org/2024/04/26/1247453317/gaza-baby-girl-mother-killed-israel-airstrike)) discusses a baby girl in Gaza who died after her mother was killed in an Israeli airstrike, including images of the baby in an incubator <image:13430>

## Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Example: reverse_search()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a rare event of a solar eclipse with a double ring."

...

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:k>)
```

# Record
## Claim

# Your Actions



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Search Result
From [Source](https://countercurrents.org/2024/07/israel-bombs-un-school-in-nuseirat/): 
Content: "They were killed with their grandmother at the school.

> NUSEIRAT  
>   
> The targeted school in Al-Nuseirat is home to 1,200 families, representing around 7,000 displaced people  
> Many children, like Mayar and Bilal, who were killed by the Israeli bombing, along with their mother and grandmother in the school that was supposed to be safe [https://t.co/oqEGO8MbW6](https://t.co/oqEGO8MbW6)

> — Nina🐝 (@papel\_em\_branco) [July 6, 2024](https://twitter.com/papel_em_branco/status/1809632675491119282?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)

Many children have also been [injured](https://t.me/QudsNen/112596)
 since the strikes were carried out at a time when children go out to play in the yards at the school to escape the heat of the classrooms.

> Breaking news  
> Several displaced persons have been KILLED and tens WOUNDED in [#Israeli\_bombing](https://twitter.com/hashtag/Israeli_bombing?src=hash&ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)

As well as those that died because of Israeli strikes, the number of those injured was injured at 75.

> At least 16 Palestinians have been killed in an Israeli attack on a UN-run school sheltering forcibly displaced people in Gaza's Nuseirat refugee camp, says the Gaza Government Media Office [https://t.co/0WtR64gtm9](https://t.co/0WtR64gtm9)
>  [pic.twitter.com/8e0mNnLaYu](https://t.co/8e0mNnLaYu)
> 
> — Al Jazeera English (@AJEnglish) [July 6, 2024](https://twitter.com/AJEnglish/status/1809656057045872753?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)

The Government Media Office in Gaza said this is the 43rd massacre committed by the Israelis. Systematic and calculated extermination of the survivors in the shelters where they starve with no access to water and healthcare [pic.twitter.com/p2Izk6vtwo](https://t.co/p2Izk6vtwo)
> 
> — Nicola Perugini (@PeruginiNic) [July 6, 2024](https://twitter.com/PeruginiNic/status/1809638986685550749?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)

The UNRWA Media Advisor Adnan Abu Hasna told Al Jazeera he estimated that the number of displaced people sheltering at the school stood at 2000 however this figure was far too low according to other experts on the ground.

https://twitter.com/NourNaim88/status/1809664477719335209

Director of Logistics at Civil Defense told Al Jazeera that the number of families at the school was 1,200 with around 7000 people.

[https://t.me/QudsNen/112596](https://t.me/QudsNen/112596)

Some of those killed included [9-year-old Mayar Haidar and 6-year-old Bilal Hamida](https://t.me/QudsNen/112595)
. At least 16 people were killed in this latest massacre at a UN school that was previously announced as a safe area by the Israeli military.

https://twitter.com/QudsNen/status/1809622090565251139

Some of the victims were displaced people from Khan Younis ordered to leave from there by the Israeli military.

> Difficult scenes from the targeting of an UNRWA school in the Nuseirat camp in the central Gaza Strip – a large number of martyrs and injuries, the majority of whom are children. First it was 11, 14, 15 and finally 16 as announced by the Gaza Ministry of Health.

> The Israeli bombardment of the UN Al Jaoni school in Gaza’s Nuseirat refugee camp. It added that since the beginning of the genocide on Gazathe Israeli army has boombed more than [17 schools and shelter centers](https://t.me/warfareanalysis/60889)
 inside the Nuseirat refugee camp.

### [70 Killed in Gaza Since Dawn, Including 36 Seeking Aid, as Famine and Siege Deepen](https://countercurrents.org/2025/07/70-killed-in-gaza-since-dawn-including-36-seeking-aid-as-famine-and-siege-deepen/)

### [Is Israel Able to Expand?](https://countercurrents.org/2025/07/is-israel-able-to-expand/)

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The article from Countercurrents.org, written by Dr. Marwan Asmar and published on July 7, 2024, reports on an Israeli bombing of a UN school in Nuseirat refugee camp. The article states that the school was sheltering displaced people and that at least 16 people were killed, including children Mayar Hamida (9 years old) and Bilal Hamida (6 years old), along with their mother and grandmother. <image:63> The article also mentions that the Gaza Government Media Office said this was the 43rd massacre committed by the Israelis.

_________________________



SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:63> This image shows Mayar Hamida (9 years old) and Bilal Hamida (6 years old) who were killed by Israel along with their mother and grandmother at Al-Jaoni UN school in Al-Nuseirat refugee camp on July, 6 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:63>)
```

## Evidence
No new evidence found.

## Elaboration
There is no new evidence to verify the claim. Therefore, I cannot assess the veracity of the claim.


## Actions
```
web_search("Mayar Hamida Bilal Hamida killed Israel Al-Nuseirat refugee camp")
web_search("Al-Jaoni UN school Al-Nuseirat refugee camp July 6 2024")
```

# Search Result
From [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuseirat_rescue_and_massacre): 
Content: "|

| Nuseirat rescue and massacre |     |
| --- | --- |
| Part of the [Gaza war](/wiki/Gaza_war "Gaza war") |     |
| [![Nuseirat refugee camp is located in the Gaza Strip](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c1/Israel_outline_northwest_negev.png/250px-Israel_outline_northwest_negev.png)](/wiki/File:Israel_outline_northwest_negev.png "Nuseirat refugee camp is located in the Gaza Strip")<br><br>![Nuseirat refugee camp](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0c/Red_pog.svg/20px-Red_pog.svg.png)<br><br>Nuseirat refugee camp<br><br>Location within the Gaza Strip |     |
| Location | [Nuseirat refugee camp](/wiki/Nuseirat_refugee_camp "Nuseirat refugee camp")<br>, [Gaza Strip](/wiki/Gaza_Strip "Gaza Strip")<br>, [Palestine](/wiki/Palestine "Palestine") |
| Date | 8 June 2024 ([UTC+02:00](/wiki/UTC%2B02:00 "UTC+02:00")<br>) |
| Attack type | [Raid](/wiki/Raid_(military) "Raid (military)")<br>, [airstrikes](/wiki/Airstrikes "Airstrikes")<br>, [massacre](/wiki/Massacre "Massacre") |
| Deaths | *   At least 276 Palestinians killed (per Palestinian health officials)[\[1\]](#cite_note-wp210-1)<br>    [\[2\]](#cite_note-2)<br>    [\[3\]](#cite_note-3)<br>    [\[a\]](#cite_note-5)<br>    <br>*   Less than 100 Palestinian casualties (Per IDF)[\[5\]](#cite_note-TOI_100-6) |
| Injured | Over 698 Palestinians[\[6\]](#cite_note-auto1-7) |
| Victims | [Palestinian](/wiki/Palestinians "Palestinians")<br> civilians and militants |
| Perpetrators | ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/de/Flag_of_the_Israel_Defense_Forces.svg/40px-Flag_of_the_Israel_Defense_Forces.svg.png)[Israel Defense Forces](/wiki/Israel_Defense_Forces "Israel Defense Forces")<br>  <br> ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/a4/Flag_of_the_United_States.svg/40px-Flag_of_the_United_States.svg.png)[United States](/wiki/United_States "United States")<br> (alleged support)[\[7\]](#cite_note-8) |

| 2024 Nuseirat rescue operation and massacre |     |
| --- | --- |
| Part of the [Gaza war](/wiki/Gaza_war "Gaza war") |     |
| [![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/ac/Operation-Summer-Seeds-0002.jpg/330px-Operation-Summer-Seeds-0002.jpg)](/wiki/File:Operation-Summer-Seeds-0002.jpg)<br><br>The landing of the rescued hostages at [Sheba Hospital](/wiki/Sheba_Hospital "Sheba Hospital") |     |
| Location | [Nuseirat refugee camp](/wiki/Nuseirat_refugee_camp "Nuseirat refugee camp") |
| Objective | Rescue [Israeli hostages](/wiki/Gaza_war_hostage_crisis "Gaza war hostage crisis")<br> held by [Hamas](/wiki/Hamas "Hamas") |
| Date | 8 June 2024 |
| Executed by | [Yamam](/wiki/Yamam "Yamam")<br>, [Shin Bet](/wiki/Shin_Bet "Shin Bet")<br>, [Israel Defense Forces](/wiki/Israel_Defense_Forces "Israel Defense Forces")<br>, [Israel Air Force](/wiki/Israel_Air_Force "Israel Air Force")<br>[\[8\]](#cite_note-toi8juneoa-9)<br>, [Israeli Navy](/wiki/Israeli_Navy "Israeli Navy")<br>[\[9\]](#cite_note-10) |
| Outcome | *   Four Israeli hostages rescued |
| Casualties | *   One Yamam officer killed<br>*   Per [Gaza Health Ministry](/wiki/Gaza_Health_Ministry "Gaza Health Ministry")<br>    , 276 Palestinians killed and 698+ injured[\[10\]](#cite_note-11)<br>    <br>*   Per IDF, less than 100 Palestinian casualties[\[5\]](#cite_note-TOI_100-6) |

On 8 June 2024, during an operation to rescue hostages held in the [Nuseirat refugee camp](/wiki/Nuseirat_refugee_camp "Nuseirat refugee camp")
, the Israeli military killed at least 276 people and injured over 698, according to the [Gaza Health Ministry](/wiki/Gaza_Health_Ministry "Gaza Health Ministry")
 and Palestinian health officials.[\[b\]](#cite_note-12)
[\[11\]](#cite_note-13)
 The operation's objective was to recover hostages taken during the [7 October Hamas-led attack on Israel](/wiki/7_October_Hamas-led_attack_on_Israel "7 October Hamas-led attack on Israel")
. No evidence for this claim was provided.[\[21\]](#cite_note-guardianhamas-23)
[\[22\]](#cite_note-AJ_-_3_killed-24)
 The [OHCHR](/wiki/Office_of_the_United_Nations_High_Commissioner_for_Human_Rights "Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights")
 said that both Israeli forces and Palestinian armed groups may have committed [war crimes](/wiki/War_crime "War crime")
.

Background
----------

The Nuseirat refugee camp was established in the Gaza Strip after the [Palestinians were expelled or fled from Israel](/wiki/1948_Palestinian_expulsion "1948 Palestinian expulsion")
 during the [1948 Palestine war](/wiki/1948_Palestine_war "1948 Palestine war")
. On 7 October 2023, the Qassam Brigades (the militant wing of the [Hamas](/wiki/Hamas "Hamas")
 party) launched [an attack on Israel](/wiki/2023_Hamas-led_attack_on_Israel "2023 Hamas-led attack on Israel")
.[\[23\]](#cite_note-25)
 As part of the attack, in which other Palestinian militant groups were also involved, Hamas, [Palestinian Islamic Jihad](/wiki/Palestinian_Islamic_Jihad "Palestinian Islamic Jihad")
 and other Palestinian militant groups kidnapped 251 Israeli civilians and soldiers.[\[24\]](#cite_note-rw10oct-26)
 This attack led to the [Gaza war](/wiki/Gaza_war "Gaza war")
.[\[24\]](#cite_note-rw10oct-26)

The [Nuseirat refugee camp](/wiki/Nuseirat_refugee_camp "Nuseirat refugee camp")
 is a long-standing [UNRWA](/wiki/UNRWA "UNRWA")
 refugee camp located in the middle of the Gaza Strip, in [Deir al-Balah](/wiki/Deir_al-Balah "Deir al-Balah")
.[\[25\]](#cite_note-27)
 The camp has been repeatedly bombed during the Israel-Hamas war, with over a hundred Palestinians killed in the attacks. [Ynet](/wiki/Ynet "Ynet")
 reported that she also cooked at times with basic ingredients she was provided.[\[36\]](#cite_note-toimalnutrition-38)

The [Qassam Brigades](/wiki/Qassam_Brigades "Qassam Brigades")
 (the militant wing of the Hamas movement) claimed that three other hostages were killed as a result of the raid.[\[22\]](#cite_note-AJ_-_3_killed-24)
[\[41\]](#cite_note-43)
 They did not name any of them, or show photographs, but they claimed that one of the three was a US citizen and released a short video with text in Arabic, Hebrew, and English.[\[22\]](#cite_note-AJ_-_3_killed-24)
 The video depicted three unidentifiable corpses with their faces obscured by censor bars.[\[42\]](#cite_note-44)
 The Brigades did not give details of how the hostages supposedly died, but said they were killed by the Israeli military.[\[c\]](#cite_note-46)

> "In exchange for them, your own army killed 3 of your own captives in the same attack; one of them holds a USA citizenship" - Qassam Brigades, 9 June 2024.[\[22\]](#cite_note-AJ_-_3_killed-24)

Rescue
------

The IDF said that they worked with [Shin Bet](/wiki/Shin_Bet "Shin Bet")
 and Israeli police to free the four Israeli hostages.[\[44\]](#cite_note-ynet8june-47)
 It was also later reported that the operation was [aided by intelligence support from the United States](/wiki/United_States_support_for_Israel_in_the_Gaza_war "United States support for Israel in the Gaza war")
[\[45\]](#cite_note-cbs8junebrennan-48)
 and the [United Kingdom](/wiki/British_support_for_Israel_in_the_Israel%E2%80%93Hamas_war "British support for Israel in the Israel–Hamas war")
.[\[46\]](#cite_note-49)
 The operation was planned for several weeks, and was carried out after an intelligence opportunity arose.[\[14\]](#cite_note-bbc-16)
 Some of the special forces members entered the refugee camp in a vehicle with a mattress on top, posing as [Palestinian refugees](/wiki/Gaza_Strip_evacuations "Gaza Strip evacuations")
 fleeing [Rafah](/wiki/Rafah "Rafah")
 per Saudi reporters. All of them need to be released immediately." He also pledged to continue "all efforts" to secure the release of hostage Tal Shoham, who holds Austrian citizenship.[\[89\]](#cite_note-toirescue-92)
    
*    ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bd/Flag_of_Cuba.svg/40px-Flag_of_Cuba.svg.png)[Cuba](/wiki/Cuba "Cuba")
    : Foreign minister [Bruno Rodriguez](/wiki/Bruno_Rodr%C3%ADguez_Parrilla "Bruno Rodríguez Parrilla")
     stated, "We condemn in the strongest terms the massacre carried out by the Israeli army in the Nuseirat refugee camp, Gaza."[\[90\]](#cite_note-93)
    
*    ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fe/Flag_of_Egypt.svg/40px-Flag_of_Egypt.svg.png)[Egypt](/wiki/Egypt "Egypt")
    : the country denounced the killing of civilians, calling it "a flagrant violation of all rules of international law".[\[91\]](#cite_note-94)
    
*    ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/c/c3/Flag_of_France.svg/40px-Flag_of_France.svg.png)[France](/wiki/France "France")
    : President [Emmanuel Macron](/wiki/Emmanuel_Macron "Emmanuel Macron")
     Macron praised the hostage rescue and called for a lasting political solution to the war in Gaza.[\[92\]](#cite_note-95)
    
*    ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/b/ba/Flag_of_Germany.svg/40px-Flag_of_Germany.svg.png)[Germany](/wiki/Germany "Germany")
    : Chancellor [Olaf Scholz](/wiki/Olaf_Scholz "Olaf Scholz")
     wrote that the rescue of the hostages was an "important sign of hope", adding that "four hostages are now free. The war must end".[\[93\]](#cite_note-96)
    
*    ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9f/Flag_of_Indonesia.svg/40px-Flag_of_Indonesia.svg.png)[Indonesia](/wiki/Indonesia "Indonesia")
    : the country condemned the "repeated atrocities" committed by Israel in Gaza, including in the Nuseirat refugee camp, and called for an immediate ceasefire.[\[94\]](#cite_note-97)
    
*    ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c0/Flag_of_Jordan.svg/40px-Flag_of_Jordan.svg.png)[Jordan](/wiki/Jordan "Jordan")
    : the country denounced the killing of civilians and called "on the international community and especially the Security Council to take immediate and urgent action to stop Israel's war crimes in Gaza."[\[95\]](#cite_note-ynetnews-98)
    
*    ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/aa/Flag_of_Kuwait.svg/40px-Flag_of_Kuwait.svg.png)[Kuwait](/wiki/Kuwait "Kuwait")
    : the country denounced the killing of civilians, calling it a "heinous crime".[\[96\]](#cite_note-99)
    
*    ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/59/Flag_of_Lebanon.svg/40px-Flag_of_Lebanon.svg.png)[Lebanon](/wiki/Lebanon "Lebanon")
    : The [Lebanese Ministry of Foreign Affairs](/wiki/Ministry_of_Foreign_Affairs_and_Emigrants_(Lebanon) "Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Emigrants (Lebanon)")
     called the operation a massacre.[\[97\]](#cite_note-usat9june-100)
    
*    ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d9/Flag_of_Norway.svg/40px-Flag_of_Norway.svg.png)[Norway](/wiki/Norway "Norway")
    : Deputy Foreign Minister Andreas Motzfeldt Kravik condemned the attack on civilians and called for the release of all hostages.[\[95\]](#cite_note-ynetnews-98)
    
*    ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/1/12/Flag_of_Poland.svg/40px-Flag_of_Poland.svg.png)[Poland](/wiki/Poland "Poland")
    : Foreign Minister [Radosław Sikorski](/wiki/Rados%C5%82aw_Sikorski "Radosław Sikorski")
     wrote: "Bravo, IDF. Israel has shown itself time and time again that it does not care about international and humanitarian laws."[\[112\]](#cite_note-115)
    
*   [Kenneth Roth](/wiki/Kenneth_Roth "Kenneth Roth")
    , the former director of [Human Rights Watch](/wiki/Human_Rights_Watch "Human Rights Watch")
     and a professor at [Princeton University](/wiki/Princeton_University "Princeton University")
    , stated the attack was "inconsistent with the duty to take all feasible precautions to spare civilians harm."[\[113\]](#cite_note-116)

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Wikipedia article discusses the Nuseirat rescue and massacre that occurred on June 8, 2024, in the Nuseirat refugee camp in the Gaza Strip. The Israeli military conducted an operation to rescue hostages, resulting in at least 276 Palestinian deaths and over 698 injuries, according to the Gaza Health Ministry. The article also mentions that the operation's objective was to recover hostages taken during the October 7 Hamas-led attack on Israel. <image:i> The article also includes reactions from various countries and organizations.

## Web Sources
**Web Search Result**

From [Source](https://countercurrents.org/2024/07/israel-bombs-un-school-in-nuseirat/): 
Content: The article from Countercurrents.org, written by Dr. Marwan Asmar and published on July 7, 2024, reports on an Israeli bombing of a UN school in Nuseirat refugee camp. The article states that the school was sheltering displaced people and that at least 16 people were killed, including children Mayar Hamida (9 years old) and Bilal Hamida (6 years old), along with their mother and grandmother. <image:63> The article also mentions that the Gaza Government Media Office said this was the 43rd massacre committed by the Israelis.


From [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuseirat_rescue_and_massacre): 
Content: The Wikipedia article discusses the Nuseirat rescue and massacre that occurred on June 8, 2024, in the Nuseirat refugee camp in the Gaza Strip. The Israeli military conducted an operation to rescue hostages, resulting in at least 276 Palestinian deaths and over 698 injuries, according to the Gaza Health Ministry. The article also mentions that the operation's objective was to recover hostages taken during the October 7 Hamas-led attack on Israel. <image:i> The article also includes reactions from various countries and organizations.

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/7/6/israeli-attack-on-un-school-used-as-shelter-in-gaza-kills-at-least-16): 
Content: "![Palestinians gather at the site of an Israeli attack on a UN school sheltering displaced people in central Gaza](/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/2024-07-06T172243Z_1772248985_RC2RP8ASQ2H1_RTRMADP_3_ISRAEL-PALESTINIANS-NUSAIRAT-STRIKE-1720289264.jpg?resize=770%2C513&quality=80)

Palestinians gather at the site of an Israeli attack on a UN school sheltering displaced people in Nuseirat refugee camp in central Gaza, July 6 \[Ramadan Abed/Reuters\]

By [Al Jazeera Staff](/author/al_jazeera_staff_150119130629458)

Published On 6 Jul 20246 Jul 2024

At least 16 Palestinians have been killed in an Israeli attack on a United Nations-run school sheltering displaced people in the Gaza Strip, the Gaza Government Media Office said, as Israel continues to pound the besieged coastal territory.

In a statement on Saturday, the Government Media Office said more than 75 people also were injured in the attack on al-Jaouni school in central Gaza’s Nuseirat refugee camp.

Recommended Stories
-------------------

list of 3 items

list 1 of 3

### [Video: Palestinian house targeted near Gaza’s Nasser Hospital](/video/newsfeed/2024/7/4/video-palestinian-house-targeted-near-gazas-nasser-hospital)

list 2 of 3

### [What does Israel want in Gaza?](/news/2024/7/4/what-does-israels-want-gaza)

list 3 of 3

### [Gaza girl inspires with cooking videos despite Israel’s siege](/video/newsfeed/2024/7/4/gaza-10-year-old-inspires-with-cooking-videos-despite-israels-siege)

end of list

“We condemn the Israeli occupation \[for\] committing these ongoing crimes and massacres against civilians, children and women,” it said.

The Nuseirat facility, run by the UN agency for Palestinian refugees (UNRWA), is [the latest school to be bombed](/news/2024/1/24/how-israel-has-destroyed-gazas-schools-and-universities)
 by the Israeli military since the Gaza war began in early October.

At least 38,098 Palestinians have been killed in Israeli attacks across Gaza since October 7 and the besieged enclave faces dire shortages of food, water, medicine and other humanitarian supplies.

On Saturday, dozens of Palestinians, [including five journalists](/news/2024/7/6/five-journalists-killed-as-israel-steps-up-bombardment-across-gaza)
, were killed as the Israeli military stepped up its bombardment of the territory.

Videos taken at the scene of the attack on the UNRWA school-turned-shelter in Nuseirat showed twisted metal at the collapsed building. Emergency workers also tried to cover two bodies as they were quickly brought into the medical complex.

The Palestinian Ministry of Health in Gaza said in a statement that 50 injured Palestinians were taken to the hospital.

In a [statement](https://x.com/IDF/status/1809662855660360020)
 shared on social media on Saturday night, the Israeli army said its air force “struck several terrorists” in the area of al-Jaouni school.

Reporting from Deir el-Balah, Al Jazeera’s Hind Khoudary said hundreds of Palestinian families had sought shelter at the school after they were forced to flee Israel’s bombardment in other parts of Gaza.

The families “chose the middle area \[of the Gaza Strip\] because Israeli forces said the middle area is a safe zone”, Khoudary said.

“Everyone in the Gaza Strip believes that they are not safe, wherever they go.”

Last month, an Israeli attack on an UN-linked school – also in Nuseirat refugee camp – [killed at least 40 people](/news/2024/6/6/israel-bombs-unrwa-school-in-gaza-kills-32-displaced-palestinians)
 and injured dozens more, according to local authorities.

Musab, a 17-year-old survivor of the early June bombing of the UNRWA Nuseirat Boys’ Preparatory School, told the UN agency that his father was killed after “missiles rained down” on the family.

“Concrete slabs fell on us, and suddenly, we found ourselves surrounded by the dead and injured. All of my family members were either injured or killed,” [Musab said](https://www.unrwa.org/newsroom/features/no-shelter-war-bombing-block-2-unrwa-nuseirat-school)
 in testimony shared by UNRWA.

“We were sleeping, and at two in the morning, missiles rained down on us. A young boy could be seen sifting through pools of blood on the ground.

Footage shot at Al-Aqsa Martyrs Hospital in nearby Deir el-Balah and verified by Al Jazeera’s Sanad agency also showed children and young people being rushed from ambulances.

They included a girl with a bandaged arm, another with a bloodied face and a boy bandage across his head. They pulled us from under the rubble, and all we saw were shrapnel, debris, and dust. How will we live?”

Source: Al Jazeera

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
Al Jazeera reports that at least 16 Palestinians were killed in an Israeli attack on a UN-run school sheltering displaced people in the Nuseirat refugee camp on July 6, 2024. <image:1>. The attack on al-Jaouni school injured more than 75 people. The Israeli army stated that its air force "struck several terrorists" in the area of al-Jaouni school. The article also mentions a previous attack in early June on another UN-linked school in Nuseirat refugee camp that killed at least 40 people. The article was published on July 6, 2024, by Al Jazeera Staff.

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c4ng04kpv2do): 
Content: "

Israeli air strike on Gaza school kills at least 16
===================================================

6 July 2024

ShareSave

Rushdi Aboualouf and Tom McArthur

BBC News

ShareSave

Shock and horror at scene of Gaza blast

**At least 16 people have been killed in an Israeli air strike on a UN-run school in the Gaza Strip, Palestinian officials have said. Dozens more have been injured.**

The building was sheltering thousands of displaced people at Nuseirat refugee camp in central Gaza, according to the Hamas-run health ministry.

Israel said it had struck several Hamas “terrorists operating in structures located in the area of Al-Jaouni School”.

A local source said the target was a room allegedly used by Hamas police. A spokeswoman for the UN agency for Palestinian refugees (Unrwa) said the claims were "very, very serious" and should be investigated.

The attack comes as [hopes rise that a deal between Israel and Hamas is on the horizon](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/c3gvp5q9y2go)
, following months of false starts.

Israel has announced it will send a team of negotiators next week to discuss a hostage release deal with Hamas.

It comes after a senior US administration official said Hamas had agreed to "pretty significant adjustments" to its position regarding a potential ceasefire.

A senior Hamas source told the Reuters news agency on Saturday that the group had agreed to begin talks on releasing Israeli hostages 16 days after the proposed first phase of an agreement aimed at ending the Gaza war.

Video from the scene of the Nuseirat school strike shows adults and children screaming in a smoke-filled street covered in dust and rubble, as they run to help the wounded.

Eyewitnesses told the BBC that the attack targeted the upper floors of the school, which is located near a busy market.

The BBC understands that up to 7,000 people were using the building as shelter.

One woman told the AFP news agency how some children were killed as they were reading the Koran when the building was hit.

"This is the fourth time they have targeted the school without warning," she said.

Hamas said five local journalists were among those killed in Israeli attacks on Saturday. Many were women and children."

She added it was not the first time Israel had made such claims, and that they should be investigated.

A previous attack in June on another packed UN-run school in Nuseirat [killed at least 35 people](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/crggq0jygq6o)
.

Local journalists told the BBC at the time that a warplane fired two missiles at classrooms on the top floor of the school.

After that attack, Israel’s military said it had “conducted a precise strike on a Hamas compound” in the school and killed many of the 20 to 30 fighters it believed were inside.

The head of the Unrwa described the June incident as "horrific" and said the claim that armed groups might have been inside a shelter was "shocking" but could not be confirmed.

Israel’s war was triggered by Hamas's unprecedented attack on Israel on 7 October in which Hamas-led gunmen killed about 1,200 people and took 251 others back to Gaza as hostages.

At least 38,098 Palestinians have been killed in Gaza as a result of Israel's offensive, according to the territory's Hamas-run health ministry.

Israel has regularly accused Unrwa of supporting Hamas, which is proscribed as a terrorist organisation by Israel, the UK, US and other countries.

The organisation has rejected this.

In April, a UN investigation found Israel had failed to back up a claim that many of the agency's staff belonged militant groups, but also said it could improve its neutrality, staff vetting and transparency.

[Hamas faces growing public dissent as Gaza war erodes support\
-------------------------------------------------------------](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/c0vewvp14zdo)

['Breakthrough' heightens hopes of Gaza ceasefire deal\
-----------------------------------------------------](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/cllyz4y6979o)

[Israel settlements drive heightens Palestinian land angst\
---------------------------------------------------------](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/czq61w10qwpo)

[Gaza Strip in maps: How life has changed\
----------------------------------------](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-20415675)

[Middle East](/news/world/middle_east)

[Israel-Gaza war](/news/topics/c2vdnvdg6xxt)

[Israel](/news/topics/c302m85q5ljt)

[Hamas](/news/topics/cnx753jen5zt)

* * * <image:2684>!A dusty and bloodied young girl is carried from an ambulance with a heavily bandaged leg <image:2685>

At least 50 people were injured in the strike, Gaza officials say.

In a statement, the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) confirmed it had hit the school buildings, saying it had taken "numerous steps" to "mitigate the risk of harming civilians, including the use of precise aerial surveillance and additional intelligence".

Hamas militants were using the location as a "hideout" to carry out attacks against IDF troops, it said.

"Hamas continues to systematically violate international law by exploiting civilian structures and the civilian population as human shields for its terrorist attacks against the State of Israel," it added.

Hamas called the attack a “massacre” on “defenceless displaced civilians”.

Many of the dead and wounded were women, children and the elderly, the group claimed via its English language Telegram channel.

! <image:2687>Reuters

The IDF said it was "looking into the details" of the incident.

Many schools and other UN facilities have been used as shelters by the 1.7 million people who have fled their homes during the war, which has lasted almost eight months.

"We don’t have all the information yet. <image:2684>!Reuters People walk through the ruins of a school that was hit by an airstrike, killing at least 16 people. Since the war began, we have had more than half of our facilities hit," Juliette Touma, Unrwa's communications director, told the BBC regarding the latest attack.

"Many of them were shelters, and as a result at least 500 people sheltering in those facilities have been killed. Members of their family were also reportedly targeted.

More than 100 journalists have lost their lives in Gaza since the 7 October attacks, according to Reporters Without Borders.

Hamas said the five latest fatalities brings the number to 158.

!"

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The BBC News reported on July 6, 2024, that at least 16 people were killed in an Israeli air strike on a UN-run school in the Nuseirat refugee camp in Gaza. The building was sheltering thousands of displaced people. Israel stated it had struck Hamas "terrorists" operating in the area. Hamas called the attack a "massacre" and said many of the dead and wounded were women, children, and the elderly. <image:2685>, <image:2687>.

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.opb.org/article/2024/09/12/the-u-n-says-6-staff-were-killed-in-an-israeli-strike-on-a-gaza-school/): 
Content: "<image:2688>

Civil defense teams and others carry out search and rescue operations after an Israeli strike on a school that was sheltering families at Nuseirat Refugee Camp in the Gaza Strip on Wednesday.

_Abed Rahim Khatib / Anadolu via Getty Images_

The United Nations relief agency for Palestinian refugees in the Gaza Strip says Israeli airstrikes [hit](https://news.un.org/en/story/2024/09/1154206)
 a school that was sheltering families in central Gaza, killing six of its employees.

THANKS TO OUR SPONSOR:

[Become a Sponsor](https://www.opb.org/sponsorship/)

The U.N. Secretary General, [called](https://x.com/antonioguterres/status/1833999121205563532)
 the strikes "dramatic violations of international humanitarian law."

“What’s happening in Gaza is totally unacceptable,” he wrote on X, formerly Twitter.

The Israeli military [said](https://x.com/ltc_shoshani/status/1834145854204104791?s=46&t=EEjh1zYA6esGSFZS8UjjYw)
 Hamas was using the school as a "command and control center."

![Palestinians mourn after the Israeli strike at Nuseirat Refugee Camp on Wednesday.](https://opb-opb-prod.cdn.arcpublishing.com/resizer/v2/X7IRRISZWX4PNPJU2EKPE5IDIA.jpg?auth=195f1f6864d06393ae08bf90f4675384be9e6f646e0199bd73e163b9827ad096&width=150)

Palestinians mourn after the Israeli strike at Nuseirat Refugee Camp on Wednesday.

_Moez Salhi / Anadolu via Getty Images_

Israel's ambassador to the United Nations, Danny Danon, responded to Guterres' criticism by [writing](https://x.com/dannydanon/status/1834056393927627060)
 on X: "It is unconscionable that the UN continues to condemn Israel in its just war against terrorists, while Hamas continues to use women and children as human shields."

UNWRA called on all parties in the conflict to “never use schools or the areas around them for military or fighting purposes” and said that “schools and other civilian infrastructure must be protected at all times."

[Become a Sponsor](https://www.opb.org/sponsorship/)

Sixteen people were reported killed in a previous Israeli attack on several structures in the Al-Jaouni school compound in July, which Israel said was being used by Hamas fighters.

UNRWA says Wednesday's attack caused the highest number of staff killed in a single incident. 12, 2024 11:49 p.m.

!Civil defense teams and others carry out search and rescue operations after an Israeli strike on a school that was sheltering families at Nuseirat Refugee Camp in the Gaza Strip on Wednesday. The population is blighted by hunger and the spread of disease.

![Rubble is strewn inside the school.](https://opb-opb-prod.cdn.arcpublishing.com/resizer/v2/NJMK6QMTRGV3MOQOG7EI4VSN6Q.jpg?auth=51dc5bc3b6e4bd9dc5f320b6a22170fd4feaf1c37050563b855bce2dd8266f55&width=150)

Rubble is strewn inside the school.

_Anas Baba for NPR_

The World Health Organization said on Wednesday it carried out its largest medical evacuation from Gaza since the start of the war, taking 97 sick and severely injured patients and 155 companions to the United Arab Emirates for treatment. The patients were 45 children and 52 adults with a wide range of conditions, including cancer and other diseases and injuries from the conflict.

Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, WHO's director-general, [said](https://x.com/DrTedros/status/1833976405149057277)
 the evacuation was a "highly complex operation" that was "completed under immense time pressure to bring all patients together."

A WHO [report](https://www.who.int/news/item/12-09-2024-who-analysis-highlights-vast-unmet-rehabilitation-needs-in-gaza/)
 published Thursday found that some 22,500 people — about a quarter of those wounded in the war in Gaza — have injuries that will require rehabilitation now and for years to come. The UN says 6 staff were killed in an Israeli strike on a Gaza school

By Ruth Sherlock (NPR)

Sept. agency, UNRWA, says this is the fifth time the al-Jaouni school has been hit since the start of the war. Philippe Lazzarini, the UNRWA Commissioner-General, said humanitarian staff are being “disregarded” in the Gaza war.

From [Source](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/7/6/israeli-attack-on-un-school-used-as-shelter-in-gaza-kills-at-least-16): 
Content: Al Jazeera reports that at least 16 Palestinians were killed in an Israeli attack on a UN-run school sheltering displaced people in the Nuseirat refugee camp on July 6, 2024. <image:1>. The attack on al-Jaouni school injured more than 75 people. The Israeli army stated that its air force "struck several terrorists" in the area of al-Jaouni school. The article also mentions a previous attack in early June on another UN-linked school in Nuseirat refugee camp that killed at least 40 people. The article was published on July 6, 2024, by Al Jazeera Staff.


From [Source](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c4ng04kpv2do): 
Content: The BBC News reported on July 6, 2024, that at least 16 people were killed in an Israeli air strike on a UN-run school in the Nuseirat refugee camp in Gaza. The building was sheltering thousands of displaced people. Israel stated it had struck Hamas "terrorists" operating in the area. Hamas called the attack a "massacre" and said many of the dead and wounded were women, children, and the elderly. <image:2685>, <image:2687>.

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:63> This image shows Mayar Hamida (9 years old) and Bilal Hamida (6 years old) who were killed by Israel along with their mother and grandmother at Al-Jaoni UN school in Al-Nuseirat refugee camp on July, 6 2024."

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
According to an article from Countercurrents.org ([https://countercurrents.org/2024/07/israel-bombs-un-school-in-nuseirat/](https://countercurrents.org/2024/07/israel-bombs-un-school-in-nuseirat/)), an Israeli bombing of a UN school in the Nuseirat refugee camp resulted in the deaths of Mayar Hamida (9 years old) and Bilal Hamida (6 years old), along with their mother and grandmother. The article states that the school was sheltering displaced people. <image:63>

A Wikipedia article ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuseirat_rescue_and_massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuseirat_rescue_and_massacre)) discusses the Nuseirat rescue and massacre that occurred on June 8, 2024, in the Nuseirat refugee camp, where the Israeli military conducted an operation to rescue hostages, resulting in at least 276 Palestinian deaths and over 698 injuries. <image:i>


### Evidence from `web_search`
Al Jazeera ([https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/7/6/israeli-attack-on-un-school-used-as-shelter-in-gaza-kills-at-least-16](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/7/6/israeli-attack-on-un-school-used-as-shelter-in-gaza-kills-at-least-16)) reported that at least 16 Palestinians were killed in an Israeli attack on a UN-run school in the Nuseirat refugee camp on July 6, 2024, which also injured more than 75 people. The Israeli army stated that it struck "several terrorists" in the area. The BBC News ([https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c4ng04kpv2do](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c4ng04kpv2do)) also reported on July 6, 2024, that at least 16 people were killed in an Israeli air strike on a UN-run school in the Nuseirat refugee camp in Gaza.

The article mentions a previous Israeli attack on the Al-Jaouni school compound in July, where sixteen people were reported killed. <image:1>, <image:2685>, <image:2687>, <image:2688>

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

# Instructions
You are provided with the record of a fact-check. It contains the Claim to be verified and a documentation of all the fact-checking work along the gathered evidence. Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:63> This image shows Mayar Hamida (9 years old) and Bilal Hamida (6 years old) who were killed by Israel along with their mother and grandmother at Al-Jaoni UN school in Al-Nuseirat refugee camp on July, 6 2024."

## Final Judgement

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Example: reverse_search()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a rare event of a solar eclipse with a double ring."

...

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:k>)
```

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "The US reinstituted draft in 2024 for the Israel-Hamas war."

# Your Actions



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
```
web_search("US draft Israel-Hamas war 2024")
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1

United States vetoes Gaza ceasefire resolution at Security Council
==================================================================

     ![A wide view of the UN Security Council as members vote on a draft resolution during the meeting on the situation in the Middle East, including the Palestinian question.](https://global.unitednations.entermediadb.net/assets/mediadb/services/module/asset/downloads/preset/Libraries/Production%20Library/20-11-2024-UN-Photo-SC-wide.jpg/image1170x530cropped.jpg "A wide view of the UN Security Council as members vote on a draft resolution during the meeting on the situation in the Middle East, including the Palestinian question.")

UN Photo/Evan Schneider

A wide view of the UN Security Council as members vote on a draft resolution during the meeting on the situation in the Middle East, including the Palestinian question.

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https://news.un.org/en/story/2024/11/1157216 "Share this via Facebook")
 [Twitter](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=United States vetoes Gaza ceasefire resolution at Security Council&url=https://news.un.org/en/story/2024/11/1157216 "Share this via Twitter")
 Print [Email](mailto:?subject=United States vetoes Gaza ceasefire resolution at Security Council&body=https://news.un.org/en/story/2024/11/1157216 "Share this via Email")

United States vetoes Gaza ceasefire resolution at Security Council
==================================================================

20 November 2024 [Peace and Security](/en/news/topic/peace-and-security)

The United States on Wednesday vetoed a UN Security Council draft resolution that demanded an immediate and unconditional ceasefire in the Gaza Strip.

Despite having secured 14 votes in favour, the draft resolution put forward by the 10 elected members of the [Security Council](https://main.un.org/securitycouncil/)
 (E10), failed to pass owing to the negative vote by a permanent member, the US.

The text also reiterated the Council’s demand for the immediate and unconditional release of all hostages.

For a resolution to be adopted, it must secure at least nine votes in favour, and no negative votes – or vetoes – by any of the five permanent members.

Under the [UN Charter](http://www.un.org/en/charter-united-nations/index.html)
, the Security Council has the primary responsibility to uphold international peace and security.

The US representative Ambassador Robert Wood said in his statement that the US could not support an unconditional ceasefire unless it was tied to releasing the hostages being held in Gaza by Hamas and other militants. 

Had the draft resolution been adopted, it would have demanded immediate access for civilians in the Gaza Strip to basic services.

It would have rejected “any effort to starve Palestinians” – the threat of famine grows in the north as the Israeli siege there continues – while also demanding the facilitation of full, rapid, safe and unhindered entry of aid at scale to and throughout the Strip and its delivery to all those in need.

The text also demanded that the parties “fully, unconditionally, and without delay” implement all the provisions of Security Council resolution 2735 (2024).

This includes the release of hostages, the exchange of Palestinian prisoners, the return of the remains of hostages who have been killed, the return of Palestinian civilians to their homes and neighbourhoods in all areas of Gaza – including in the north – and a full withdrawal of Israeli forces from Gaza.

The draft further underscored the role of the UN relief agency for Palestine refugees ([UNRWA](https://www.unrwa.org/)
) as the backbone of the humanitarian response in Gaza.

It called on all parties to enable UNRWA to carry out its mandate as adopted by the General Assembly, with full respect for the humanitarian principles of humanity, neutrality, impartiality, and independence.

It also urged respect for international humanitarian law, including the protection of UN and humanitarian facilities, while welcoming the Secretary-General’s and UNRWA’s commitment to fully implement the recommendations of an independent review of the agency led by former French Foreign Minister Catherine Colonna.

♦ Receive daily updates directly in your inbox - [**Subscribe here**](https://news.un.org/en/content/un-newsletter-subscribe?utm_source=UN News&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=un_news_newsletter)
 to a topic.

♦ Download the UN News app for your [**iOS**](https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/un-news-reader/id496893005?mt=8)
 or [**Android**](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=org.un.mobile.news&hl=en)
 devices.

### [What's In Blue](https://www.securitycouncilreport.org/whatsinblue/)

Posted Tue 19 Nov 2024

*   [Print](https://www.securitycouncilreport.org/whatsinblue/2024/11/vote-on-a-draft-resolution-on-the-war-in-gaza.php?print=true)
    
*   [Share](https://www.addtoany.com/share)
    

Vote on a Draft Resolution on the War in Gaza\*
===============================================

Tomorrow morning (20 November), the Security Council is expected to vote on a draft resolution on the [war in Gaza between Israel and Hamas](https://www.securitycouncilreport.org/middle-east-including-the-palestinian-question/)
, which was put forward by the Council’s ten elected members (E10). The remaining 14 members voted in favour.

Tags: [Insights on the Middle East](https://www.securitycouncilreport.org/whatsinblue/insights-on-the-middle-east)
, [Middle East including the Palestinian Question](https://www.securitycouncilreport.org/whatsinblue/israelpalestine)

Sign up for What's In Blue emails

Subscribe

*   [Print](https://www.securitycouncilreport.org/whatsinblue/2024/11/vote-on-a-draft-resolution-on-the-war-in-gaza.php?print=true)
    
*   [Share](https://www.addtoany.com/share)
    

*   [Share post](https://www.addtoany.com/share)
    

 

*   [Share or print this page](https://www.addthis.com/bookmark.php?v=250&pubid=ra-4fff208a7891f522)
